jobs.description: Business Unit Overview Feeding the world is what we do how we do it is unique. We are not your textbook consumer packaged goods company. While others may be slow to make change happen, Post continuously drives both inorganic and organic growth. Our history is evidence of that fact with over 100 years of heritage and growth from brands that transcend generations like Honey Bunches of Oats, Fruity Pebbles, Malt O Meal, Bob Evans, Kibbles 'n Bits, Egg Beaters, Peter Pan peanut butter and more. Our foodservice and ingredient businesses supply other products you love for brands, restaurants and stores. Our offices and manufacturing sites are in more than 60 locations in five countries, and we have 11,500+ employees. Over the past 12 years, Post has made 25+ acquisitions and reached $7.9 billion in net sales in fiscal 2024. During turbulent times of market uncertainty, the food industry has provided a level of stability unlike other industries. Post Holdings, Inc. is a Fortune 500® company headquartered in Brentwood, a suburb of St. Louis, Missouri. Our casual professional atmosphere encourages team members to collaborate, innovate and support our operating companies. Our passion and drive advance the reputation of our operating companies and brands—together, we make a difference. Responsibilities The Decision Science team helps our operating companies solve their most challenging problems and drives decisions with data. As a Senior Data & Analytics Architect, you will lead and collaborate with cross functional teams to build scalable and efficient data products and solutions to enable data centric decision making. You will be at the forefront of shaping standards and executing best practices for all aspects of data management naming, governing, managing, modeling, data engineering, data security etc. With your expertise in data modeling and leading analytics projects, you will be responsible for ensuring that data products that are built are robust, scalable, reflect the data architecture standards. You have excellent business engagement and leadership skills and thrive on building strong partnerships and working relationships with business and analytics leaders at all levels. Key Responsibilities Lead enterprise and divisional analytic projects, own end to end development and deployment, provide oversight of data architecture design, data quality and timely delivery Work closely with business stakeholders across our businesses to understand their analytics needs and translate them into scalable and performant technical solutions and align architectural strategies with organizational goals Lead the design and development of complex analytics and data products that address supply chain marketing and back office challenges and opportunities Be the subject matter expert for the current capabilities, data elements and metrics available in the data lake, with a thorough understanding of the existing data pipelines, schedules and dependencies Define and enforce development guidelines, standards and best practices for data integration pipelines and data management Ensure data quality, security, and governance across all analytics solutions. Think like an owner and a champion of data platform quality, performance, and data integrity so that it's something you are proud of Define, create and maintain artifacts of Enterprise Data solutions such as data flow diagrams, conceptual/logical data models, data dictionaries Get your hands dirty with data integration tools and providing end to end data solution designs (both high level and low level) Collaborate with D&A teams across the Enterprise to understand data management needs, provide thought leadership in data related projects and initiatives Work closely with data architects and engineers to ensure all data products are cataloged in conformance with standards and cataloging is practiced as an integral part of data product lifecycle Champion the adoption of data catalog to enable driving value through collaboration Develop and maintain metrics and KPI's tracking the health of data from the perspective of quality, availability, usability, and other factors relevant to business interests Works with the Data Governance Analyst to help implement policies; processes defined in the governance framework Foster innovation by keeping abreast of emerging technologies, creating scalable architectures to drive continuous innovation Build visibility and awareness of the gap between current state architecture and future state and influence project and product roadmaps in their journey to the adoption of the future state. Identify opportunities to optimize system performance, scalability, and reliability through architectural enhancements, code optimizations, etc. Seek to simplify process, architecture and tool selection over time with elegant design Be a problem finder to uncover opportunities for improvement in the business Challenge the status quo with new data products, technologies, and innovative problem solutions Monitor industry trends, remain current with industry best practices and identify emerging technologies that should be adopted Encourage and inspire others to find creative solutions, embrace change and collaborate on innovative approaches to achieve business outcomes Championing continuous improvement initiatives to elevate the game and operational maturity of the team Develop a roadmap of the capabilities needed on the team to reach strategic objectives and effectively match people, their interest and ability levels to drive them to achieve their personal best Mentor junior data management system team on data management system and solution methods, best practices, and applications Qualifications QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information systems or another quantitative field is required or relevant experience 8 10 years of relevant experience in data architecture, data warehousing, or business intelligence, with a strong focus on enterprise level data integration and platform development 5+ years of experience in leading data engineering teams or architecture teams, including responsibility for strategic data platform design and cross enterprise collaboration Advanced knowledge and hands on experience in database design, dimensional modeling, and business intelligence design principles. Must possess strong SQL knowledge Experienced in agile and waterfall project implementation methodologies Hands on experience developing analytics solutions using Snowflake, dbt, and Tableau. Should be able to communicate value and present insights Strong working knowledge of ERPs such as JDE, SAP, Oracle eBiz, Netsuite and functional domains a plus Working knowledge and experience in data governance, cataloging and data quality principles Knowledge of CPG business function is preferred. Possess strong business acument and consistently demonstrates forward thinking Able to effectively work with ambiguous or incomplete information and is unphased by change Ability to function under close deadlines with minimal supervision Strong people skills, cooperative and assertive in coordinating with various stakeholders across the organization Can quickly flex to changing priorities, ability to self manage and multitask and lead the team in adapting to changes Provocative thinker who is courageous to share his or her thoughts regardless of the level of the audience Strong leadership skills: ability to use influence to build consensus between both leaders and peers Self motivated individual who can identify issues/opportunities for improvement and be proactive in addressing them Demonstrates ownership of project outcomes and decisions Intellectual curiosity, passion for problem solving, a test and learn mentality and thrives in ambiguity Bring a sense of fun, passion, and positive attitute to every day Communicate in a succinct, friendly manner that promotes directness and respect. Able to translate complex concepts and situations into plain language & ability to speak both business and technical language Voracious hunger for learning and desire to win The pay range for this position is $102,931 $152,338 per year. show less

jobs.description: Employment Type: Full Time, Experienced Department: Legal As a Senior eDiscovery Analytics Lead for Contact Government Services, you will be using your legal experience to aid a large federal agency in achieving its mission. You will be providing electronic discovery technical support and assisting with strategic and legal aspects using Relativity. CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates that are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities. Skills and attributes for success: Performs analysis, development, and implementation of processing approaches for electronic files Consult with attorneys and support staff for conforming to ESI specifications and, as required, participate in teleconferences with co counsel, client agencies, and opposing counsel upon attorney request Responsible for ensuring that incoming and outgoing productions are made pursuant to the applicable ESI specifications and when deficiencies are found, provides case attorney with detailed notice of deficiencies Performs advanced analytics in Relativity Creates, troubleshoots, and repairs Active Learning Projects in Relativity Provides input on technology options to respond to specific discovery Ensures standard procedures for electronic discovery and litigation support projects are consistently applied across the life of the case Creates statistical reports providing information on collection, filtering, processing, review, and production Stays abreast of emerging electronic discovery litigation support technology and processes Maintains current knowledge of available software applications and in area(s) of expertise Contributes to regular briefings on new technology and process improvements with regard to electronic discovery Generates custom PowerShell scripts Creates/supports Case Map / Text Map databases Qualifications: A minimum of 5 years of experience providing eDiscovery services and litigation support on complex and large cases involving complex eDiscovery challenges Thorough knowledge of the litigation discovery process, and the EDRM workflow Advanced knowledge of Relativity (front end and back end) Demonstrated ability to generate complex PowerShell scripts Advanced hands on experience with Active Learning Have demonstrated exceptional written and verbal communication skills Possess detailed planning and organizational skills and have a thorough understanding of processes at each stage of the eDiscovery lifecycle Prior knowledge and experience managing eDiscovery projects and related technologies is required Ability to work in a fast paced environment and meet deadlines Work as part of a team to be able to manage complex relationships with all stakeholders Be well organized, a strong communicator, detail oriented, demonstrate good judgment, and be confident working independently Undergraduate degree required and 5+ years of prior relevant experience. Law degree, technical certification, or other pertinent graduate degree strongly preferred Must be a United States Citizen Ideally, you will also have: Knowledge of how to perform advanced searches in Relativity; generate Search indexes, and set up workflows; permissions; and Case Dynamics Write scripts for workflow improvements, utilities, and/or data manipulation Generate complex productions out of Relativity In depth hands on experience with Case Map and Text Map Able to obtain Public Trust security clearance Our commitment Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. jobs.description: NinjaHoldings was founded in 2017 by a team seeking to revolutionize the way everyday Americans interact with financial services. Through our CreditNinja and NinjaCard brands, we empower people overlooked by traditional financial institutions to take control of their finances via a full suite of digital banking and lending products, providing incentives and rewards along the way as we guide them on a path to financial improvement. Through our NinjaEdge brand, we help companies better understand their customers by offering a package of bespoke underwriting, fraud detection, and analytics services. With offices in Chicago, Miami, and around the world through the power of remote work, we are a lean and innovative team always seeking like minded talent to join us in our fight to disrupt consumer finance. Job Summary The Senior Product Manager will report directly to the Chief Risk Officer (CRO) of NinjaHoldings. This person will be responsible for driving the initiatives that directly impact key business goals such as loan volume growth and portfolio performance. They will also be responsible for prioritizing the roadmap for the Risk team and determining what best meets the business goals while ensuring essential "business as usual" work is not forgotten. In addition to the Risk team, they will work directly with many departments such as Marketing, Engineering, Compliance, and Finance to ensure all are aligned in the pursuit of the key goals. The right candidate will be analytical we're a lending business driven by numbers and driving numbers and technical to support the design and implementation of scalable solutions. They will be a personable Type A personality success requires working with and through other teams on complicated and complex projects. They will be able to move quickly from big picture thinking to detail oriented thinking. Key Responsibilities: Manage and prioritize strategic projects in partnership with the Risk team, ensuring alignment with key business outcomes. Support the technical design and implementation of decisioning models and platforms, working closely with Risk, Engineering and other PMs. Translate and clarify technical requirements to ensure readiness for development. Regularly attend department and product level meetings to remain aware of how Risk and other departments’ efforts may impact the overall roadmap and company goals Work closely with Marketing, Compliance, Bank Partnerships, Legal, and Engineering to ensure alignment across teams. Use data to evaluate and communicate project impact, make informed trade offs, and guide decision making at the department level Be the nexus of understanding regarding "how the products work" from the perspective of Risk, Marketing, Engineering, Compliance and Call Center. Ideal Candidate Will Have: 5+ years product management experience in financial services Demonstrated success delivering projects that require coordination and alignment of multiple departments Experience writing requirements for Engineering and other departments Experience supporting or leading the implementation of decision engines or other technical platforms Strong ability to determine priority of projects with disparate goals coming from various departments Strong ability to pitch ideas to department heads through the use of data and strategic thinking Strong ability to distill the needs of our customers to various departments Strong analytical ability to determine the impact of projects to a product's success Expertise in one of the following areas: Risk, Marketing, Software Engineering Additional Pluses: Deep experience in consumer lending Ability to write SQL You've worked in a startup You've started a business Benefits: Competitive salary and benefits package Flexible, remote work Fun, fast paced work environment Dynamic start up culture Ability to make an immediate impact in a growth stage company Convenient downtown Chicago office located in the heart of the city Equal opportunity employer IMPORTANT NOTICE: Please carefully review communications to ensure that they are from the official Breezy applicant tracking platform (@breezy mail.com) or an official NinjaHoldings brand email: @ninjaholdings.com, @creditninja.com, @ninjacard.com, or @edgescore.com. If you have been contacted regarding a job opening at NinjaHoldings from any other email address, including similar email variations, this is NOT a trusted source. We recommend that you refrain from responding to suspicious emails and file a complaint with the FBI's Internet Crime Compliant Center (IC3) at https://www.ic3.gov. For questions or to confirm the authenticity of a communication, please email hr @ ninjaholdings.com. show less

jobs.description: Senior Software Engineer, Applications Job Overview About CLARA CLARA Analytics is the leading AI as a service (AIaaS) provider that improves casualty claims outcomes for commercial insurance carriers and self insured organizations. The company’s product suite for workers comp, commercial auto and general liability insurance claims applies image recognition, natural language processing, and other AI based techniques to unlock insights from medical notes, bills and other documents surrounding a claim. CLARA’s customers include companies from the top 25 global insurance carriers to large third party administrators and self insured organizations. Founded in 2017, CLARA Analytics is headquartered in California’s Silicon Valley. For more information, visit www.claraanalytics.com. About the Role Join CLARA Analytics as a Senior Software Engineer, Applications and help us build AI powered products that are revolutionizing the insurance industry. Reporting into the AVP of Engineering for Applications, you'll work across our full technology stack using Java, Spring, Angular, and AWS to build products ranging from robust microservices to analytics dashboards that surface AI driven insights for insurers. If you're a skilled senior engineer who wants to make a meaningful impact at a growing startup that's defining the future of insurance claims, we want to hear from you! What You’ll Do... Collaborate with cross functional teams (Product Management, Design, and Data Science) to design, develop, and implement high quality features across the entire software stack front end and back end. Drive technical decisions around data modeling, API design, and technology selection across our AWS native architecture. Lead the design and implementation of robust microservices using Java and Spring Boot to power our analytics applications. Build responsive, data rich frontend applications using Angular and TypeScript, focusing on data intelligence and analytics dashboards. Develop and optimize database schemas and queries for AWS RDS (MySQL/Postgres) and Elastic Cloud. Research and recommend technical improvements that enhance our analytics capabilities and product features. Participate in technical planning and contribute to our engineering culture and development processes. What We’re Looking For... Required: 6+ years developing production applications using Java, Spring frameworks (e.g., Spring Boot, Spring MVC) Strong proficiency in Angular and TypeScript with experience in modern front end tooling for building complex, data driven UX Strong API design skills with RESTful principles, OpenAPI/Swagger documentation, and secure authentication flows AWS ecosystem expertise: S3, Lambda, SAM, RDS (MySQL/PostgreSQL), Elastic Cloud, IAM, and CloudFormation Database design and optimization experience with MySQL/PostgreSQL for analytics and reporting applications Knowledge of event driven architectures using AWS Lambda, SQS, and SNS Ability to lead complex architectural decisions and technical investigations and effectively communicate trade offs to both technical and business stakeholders Take ownership of features from conception to deployment, working autonomously across teams to deliver impactful solutions that drive business outcomes Preferred: CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, Gitlab), Docker containerization, and infrastructure as code (Terraform) Experience with Elasticsearch and Elastic Cloud for search and analytics use cases Experience with AWS monitoring, logging, and observability tools (CloudWatch, X Ray) Previous experience in the insurance or healthcare tech industries, especially at a startup Background in insurance or healthcare analytics where you've built data solutions that improved underwriting accuracy, claims processing efficiency, or fraud detection What We Offer... The opportunity to make a real impact on a growing company. Collaborative and supportive work environment. Competitive salary (base + bonus) and benefits package (employer provided health and ancillary insurance, flexible PTO, fully remote, 401k with match, etc.) Be a part of a team that is passionate about what we do! NOTE: we are unable to provide sponsorship. show less
